text.content: BAKEWELL, - I am not more than human.
I am more human than is wholly convenient, and your anecdote was welcome.
What you say about UNWILLING WORK, my dear sir, is a consideration always present with me, and yet not easy to give its due weight to.

You grow gradually into a certain income; without spending a penny more, with the same sense of restriction as before when you painfully scraped two hundred a year together, you find you have spent, and you cannot well stop spending, a far larger sum; and this expense can only be supported by a certain production.
However, I am off work this month, and occupy myself instead in weeding my cacao, paper chases, and the like.

I may tell you, my average of work in favourable circumstances is far greater than you suppose: from six o'clock till eleven at latest, and often till twelve, and again in the afternoon from two to four.
My hand is quite destroyed, as you may perceive, to-day to a really unusual extent.
I can sometimes write a decent fist still; but I have just returned with my arms all stung from three hours' work in the cacao.
